summary: Phoebe Curtis Orr was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) from 1976 to 1978. Her employment is documented in several payroll certifications and certification reports from the HSCA. These documents list her name, position, annual salary, and gross pay for various accounting periods. A final determination notification from the Assassination Records Review Board mentions payroll authorization forms for Orr from 1976-1978, detailing her employment with the HSCA and related salary information. Social Security numbers were redacted from these forms to protect her personal privacy.
significance: Phoebe Curtis Orr's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, the congressional committee tasked with investigating the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. The documents related to her employment provide insight into the staffing and financial operations of the HSCA during its investigation.
